title.narrative: Stronger civil society network for better and more coherent policies

description.narrative: The Finnish NGDO Platform to the EU (Kehys) is an advocacy network for Finnish civil society organisations. Kehys is interested in European Union?s actions to tackle global poverty. Kehys influences Finlands?s positions as a member of the EU and EU?s actio ns that have an impact on developing countries. Kehys serves CSOs by promoting cooperation and networking between Finnish and European CSO disseminating information about EU?s development policy and development cooperation and providing training and counse lling on EU funding opportunities.Kehys has two main sets of activities: advocacy and civil society capacity building. As an advocacy network the main objective of Kehys is to promote EU?s different policies so that they will support reduction of poverty a nd inequality and realization of human rights and equal opportunities.In 2016-2018 thematic advocacy priorities of Kehys will be institutional policy coherence human development security and development and sustainable and green economy. The first two will be covered by support from the MFA while the two latter will be implemented with external project funding.As an advocacy network and civil society capacity builder the purpose of Kehys is to enable Finnish CSOs to follow and participate actively in discus sion and action at European level. Kehys provides an opportunity for the Finnish civil society to influence EU development policy as members of a network while strengthening the capacity to be full-fledged members of the network. Kehys will continue to bui ld the capacity of Finnish CSOs regarding EU development policy and EU funding instruments.Kehys is the Finnish national platform of the European Conferederation for Relief and Development NGOs CONCORD. Through Kehys facilitation Finnish CSOs are represent ed in CONCORD working groups and engage actively in European discussion.Kehys activities are based on sustainable and organized administration which lays the basis for long-term and effective action and for its monitoring and evalution.
